item.title: Modern C++ Design Pattern/Chatper 7. 브릿지
item.description: Bridge Pattern Pimpl (Pointer to Implmentation) struct Person { string name; void greet(); Person(); ~Person(); class PersonImpl; PersonImpl *impl; // refer to gsl::owner<T> }; struct Person:PersonImpl { void greet(Person* p); } Person::Person() : impl(new PersonImpl) {} Person::~Person() { delete imple; } void Person::greet() { impl->greet(this); } void Person::PersonImpl::greet(Person* p) { printf("hello %s", p->name.c_str()); } Props Hide implementation. If Person class has many private/protected member variable, it is exposed though the header file to client.
